title: Nimish
description: This is a light, set cream from Lucknow flavoured with saffron and rosewater – a typical sweet from the era of the Nawabs and their very inventive chefs. It is standard practice to present the nimish covered with silver leaf as well as pistachios.
tips: Make the day before you plan to serve it.

default: pinch saffron strands, soaked in 100ml/3½fl oz warm milk for 15 minutes
To decorate: few chopped pistachios and edible silver leaf (optional)

steps: Whip the cream in a bowl until soft peaks just start to form – it’s important not to over-whisk it.

Sift in the icing sugar, then add the rosewater and the now cool saffron milk and strands. Whisk together for a minute until smooth and a few bubbles appear on the surface. Pour gently into small serving bowls or glasses and chill overnight.
Decorate with sliced pistachios, and silver leaf if you like. Serve.
